info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 25 at 6:22AM EDT until July 25 at 6:45AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER...NORTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND AND ARMSTRONG COUNTIES... At 622 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Ford City, or near Kittanning, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Vandergrift, Kittanning, Apollo, New Kensington, Lower Burrell, Harrison Township, Arnold, Tarentum, Natrona Heights, Brackenridge, Ford City, and Leechburg. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
